short_summary: Minor Use Pesticide Program (MUPP) Residue Analysis - Pest Management Centre
description: The bid solicitation is intended to result in the award of multiple contracts from contract award to March 31, 2025.
full_summary:
**Minor Use Pesticide Program (MUPP) Residue Analysis Tender**
================================

**Notice Title:**
Request for Proposals (RFP) for Analytical Services for Pesticide Residues in Crop Samples

**Reference:** cb-7433-46834109

**Publication Date:** July 21, 2023
**Closing Date:** August 30, 2023, 12:00 PM EST
**Expected Contract Start Date:** September 11, 2023
**Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2025

**Project Overview:**
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites proposals from qualified laboratories to conduct chemical analysis for pesticide residues on crop samples collected from field trials at various Canadian locations. The analysis must be performed in accordance with the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Principles of Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) (rev 1997) and Health Canada’s Pest Management Regulatory Agency (PMRA) Residue Chemistry Guidelines.

**Project Scope:**
The successful bidder(s) will be responsible for analyzing up to 9 projects, each consisting of multiple crop trials and samples. The projects include the analysis of various pesticides, such as azoxystrobin, propiconazole, and pyrethrins. The bidder(s) will be required to use specific analytical methods, as specified in the RFP.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The evaluation criteria for this RFP include:

* Technical merit (40%)
* Price (60%)

**Submission Requirements:**
Proposals must be submitted on a project-by-project basis and must include:

* A completed Residue Analysis Application Form (Appendix C – Annex 1)
* A detailed analysis plan for each project
* A description of the analytical methods and equipment to be used
* A description of the laboratory's quality control and quality assurance procedures

**Contact Information:**
For further information, please contact:
Kyle Harrington
kyle.harrington@agr.gc.ca
5555555

**Note:**
This RFP is subject to changes or cancellations, and AAFC reserves the right to modify or terminate this RFP at any time. By submitting a proposal, bidders acknowledge that they have read, understood, and agree to abide by the terms and conditions of this RFP. E&M CMD.00-J.nstm-free.P.nforc ....
